transcripts.text: Because I'm the only black person here in this pool, they wanna question me, but it was two Caucasian people sitting right over there and she said nothing to them.  Do you have a room in here?  I do, and I feel it's discrimination.  I have a room here, and I told her that.  And I told, no, let me explain.  My statue, she called you officer, and she called you here.  So y'all both here harassing me.  Why have my children in the pool?  Where's my proof?  This is my proof.  Okay?  This is my proof.  Um, I have a room here.  I don't need to give my name.  I didn't break the law.  It was two white people sitting over there.  She said nothing to them.  She said to me, oh, because it's always people like you using the pool unauthorized.  Who's people like me?  Once I prove I had a room that was for you to walk around and not commit a crime, you are all degrading me like this in front of my kids.  They trying to enjoy themselves in the pool.
Because I'm taking a phone call at the Doubletree Hotel.  Say hi, Earl.
